poem:
**Group Chat Revelations**

In a spiral of secrets,  
whispers unfurl,  
not in corridors or chambers,  
but in the flicker  
of a private screen—  
borders blur,  
plans poised  
on digital lips,  
while echoes call  
for answers,  
resignations sink,  
like stones  
in uncertain seas,  
yet the question hangs,  
untethered.  
What next  
in this storm  
of unseen words?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Trump team group chat news is obscuring an essential question | Mohamad Bazzi The revelation that top members of Donald Trump’s administration disclosed top-secret US military plans against the Houthi militia in Yemen in a private group chat that included a prominent journalist has generated predictable outrage in Washington. Democrats are calling for a congressional investigation and the resignation of some of the officials involved in the breach, including the defense secretary, Pete Hegseth,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

Democrats are calling for a congressional investigation and the resignation of some of the officials involved in the breach, including the defense secretary, Pete Hegseth,
